"On March 14, 2020, the President of the Republic decided to take measures to reduce contact and travel to the entire territory to the minimum as of March 16 at 12 a.m .:

A contingency plan triggered from today; mobile hospitals deployed by the national army,
Prohibition of all public demonstrations for one month
Cruise ships banned from entering Senegal
Schools and universities closed from Monday March 16
Suspension of Muslim and Christian pilgrimage procedures
Calls on the religious authorities to accompany the State in the measures adopted
Independence Day celebration 4 April canceled, instead a ceremony of taking up arms at the Palace will be organized
Calls on the Senegalese diaspora to respect the instructions issued in their country of residence
Violations of these rules will be penalized."

description:
Senegal
 Louga, March 5 [2020] (APS) - A response system is in place throughout the Louga region for the management of a possible suspected case of the coronavirus, from sampling to evacuation, if confirmed, towards dedicated services, reassured, Thursday in Louga, the regional chief doctor, Cheikh Sadibou Senghor.
 
"It is a response mechanism that has been set up at the regional level like the mechanism set up at the national level. There is the Regional Epidemic Management Committee which has been set up to deal with a possible coronavirus case, ”he said.
 
Doctor Senghor was speaking at a Regional Development Committee (CRD) on Coronavirus disease chaired by the governor of the region, El Hadj Bouya Amar
 
"At the level of each health center, we have set up a system for the management of suspected cases. We also insisted that there be in each health center, a room that can accommodate this case", he assured.
.
The regional chief doctor also indicated that trained personnel as well as personal protective equipment are available for those who must ensure the care and blood sampling from a patient.
 
"After the sample, a secure device for transferring samples to the Institut Pasteur is set up. And at the level of hospitals, premises have been identified for the isolation of patients pending confirmation or not," he said. -he explains.

`` We inaugurated the health post in the Zone, a high school with funding of over 63 million, thanks to co-financing from the Social Development Fund (FSD), the town hall and a contribution from the populations '' , explained the mayor of Kolda, Abdoulaye "Bibi" Baldé.

Senegal
December 31st 2020
In 2021, four new hospitals will be received in Kédougou, Kaffrine, Sédhiou and Touba .

33 Emergency Reception Units and 7 intensive care units will be brought up to standard in Diourbel, Fatick, Kaffrine, Kaolack, Louga, Matam and Saint Louis .

Six dialysis centers will be opened in Ndioum, Kolda, Kaffrine, Sédhiou, Agnam and Kédougou , bringing the number to 25 .

The care of cancer patients will be strengthened with the construction of the National Oncology Center of Diamniadio, the work of which will start in March.

Already, 11 of our 14 regions are equipped with mammography machines, and 4 linear accelerators for radiotherapy have been acquired, in addition to free chemotherapy for patients suffering from female cancers.

Likewise, 500 doctors and 1,000 paramedics, primarily specialists, will be recruited and assigned taking into account the disadvantaged areas of the health map

description:
Senegal
April 3rd 2020

Decree n ° 2020-830 of March 23, 2020 proclaimed a state of emergency on the national territory. This decree had enabled the public authorities to take all measures tending to restrict public freedoms in order to stem the Covid-19 and curb its spread.

However, despite the measures taken, the pandemic has grown to worrying proportions, necessitating the extension of the state of emergency.

This is why and in accordance with article 69 of the Constitution, the National Assembly, by adopting law n ° 2020-13 of 02 April 2020, authorized the President of the Republic to extend the state of emergency for a period of three (3) months.

However, it should be noted that by authorizing the extension of the state of emergency, the National Assembly set a maximum deadline which would not have been exceeded by the Head of State.

Nevertheless, depending on his power to assess the situation, the Head of State can manage this period in sequential phases until the total expiration of these three (3) months if the contingencies justify it.

In other words, it is up to the President of the Republic to assess the sequences of prorogation in the period of three (3) months authorized by the National Assembly.

Thus, for the first sequence, the Head of State decided to extend for thirty (30) days the state of emergency declared by Decree No. 2020-830 of March 23, 2020. UPDATE: Extends the deadline from June 23rd July5 and extends reach to entire nation

Continuing his communication, the Head of State indicates that, faced with the spread of the Covid-19 pandemic, there is an urgent need to redouble vigilance, commitment and resilience to contain, as quickly as possible, the disease in through individual and collective respect for barrier measures and preventive health precautions.

In view of the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic on our economy and the balance of our society, the President of the Republic underlines the need to anticipate and act in "Diligence" and "Fast Track" modes. The President of the Republic also asks the Minister of Health and Social Action to raise awareness among health actors and populations, on respecting medical appointments and regular attendance at health structures, while paying particular attention to the optimal progress of the Expanded Program on Immunization (EPI).

description:
On the 25th of March the Senegalese government published a decree outlining the restrictive measures in the land transport sector for the fight against Covid-19: 
-The boarding of passengers in buses, minibuses and coaches providing public and private passenger transport is done with due regard to the seats and a distance of at least one (1) meter between the passengers.

-The entrances and exits of public transport stations must respect the health and safety measures adopted by the competent health authority

Any use of the urban passenger bus station not directly linked to transport activities is prohibited.

-The number of passengers on board private and public transportation vehicles is limited to half the number of seats indicated on the vehicle registration card.

-In the event that the number of seats in the vehicle is odd, the number of admissible passengers is the total number of seats divided by two.

-Drivers or public transportation employees must ensure that all the necessary hygiene rules are observed, in particular through the use of hydro-alcoholic products and hand washing

-The number of passengers on board city taxis or private vehicles with five (5) seats is limited to three (3), including the driver.

-The number of passengers on board vehicles with two wheels is one (1).

description:
Senegal 
March 25th2020



First article. - This decree sets out the restrictive measures taken in the land transport sector, as part of the fight against Covid 19.

 

Article 2: The boarding of passengers in buses, minibuses and coaches providing public and private passenger transport is carried out with respect for the seats and a distance of at least one (1) meter between passengers.

 

Article 3: Entrances and exits from urban passenger stations are carried out in compliance with the health and safety measures adopted by the competent health authority.

Any use of the urban passenger bus station not directly linked to transport activities is prohibited.

 

Article 4: The number of passengers on board all categories of private vehicles and public passenger transport vehicles is limited to half the number of places indicated on the vehicle registration card.

In the event that the number of seats in the vehicle is odd, the number of admissible passengers is the whole number resulting from the division by two.

When handling transport cards, banknotes and coins, transport operators must ensure that all necessary hygiene rules are respected, in particular by the use of hydro-alcoholic products and hand washing.

 

Article 5: The number of passengers aboard city taxis of private vehicles with five (5) seats is limited to three (3), including the driver.

 

Article 6: The number of passengers in two-wheeled vehicles is limited to one

description:
Senegal
Diourbei
July 28th 2021
On the occasion of the Regional Development Committee (CRD) preparatory for the Grand Magal of Touba, the chief medical officer of the health district of the Diourbel region reassured that the authorities have already taken important measures to ensure good media coverage during of this religious event.

According to Doctor Mamadou Dieng, 180 service points will be located in the Diourbel region. He also announced the deployment of 5,760 health workers who will come as reinforcements to take charge of the pilgrims during the magal.

Note that the preparatory CRD for the Grand Magal of Touba was held this Wednesday in Diourbel under the aegis of Governor Gorgui Mbaye in the presence of Cheikh Bassirou Mbacké Abdou khadre, president of the organizing committee of this great event, Cheikh Abdou Lahad Mbacké Gaïndé Fatma, president of the culture and communication committee, among others.

Thus, Serigne Bassirou Mbacké Abdou khadre recommends all pilgrims and disciples in particular to scrupulously respect the measures decreed by the medical authorities to fight against the coronavirus.

“We must comply with guidelines issued by health authorities to respond to the pandemic. I invite everyone to respect these recommendations ”, he ordered the disciples, in particular the pilgrims who will have to attend the celebration of the magal of Touba.
